article.headline: Portland State 79, Sacramento State 69
article.story: PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) -- Seamus Boxley scored 25 points and grabbed eight rebounds to carry Portland State to a 79-69 win over Sacramento State on Thursday. Blake Walker added 15 points and Will Funn had 11 points and 12 assists for the Vikings (10-4, 2-0 Big Sky Conference), who won their sixth straight game. Jameel Pugh led Sacramento State (3-10, 0-1) with 18 points. DaShawn Freeman and Jason Harris added 14 points each for the Hornets. Portland State survived a season-high 29 turnovers and 63 percent shooting from the free throw line. Sacramento State committed 24 turnovers and shot 37 percent from the field. The Hornets trailed 41-24 at the half, but rallied to within one -- 57-56 -- when Pugh capped a 13-2 run with a 3-pointer. But the Vikings hit the Hornets with a burst of their own and never relinquished the lead. Sacramento State started the first half in good shape, leading 21-20 with just under seven minutes left. But the Vikings went on a 19-2 run over the next four minutes to take a commanding lead. Boxley had nine points during the stretch, which was punctuated by Antone Jarrell's reverse breakaway dunk. ^

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
